definitions.text: rib section of a forequarter of veal or pork or especially lamb or mutton
the destruction or collapse of something
an instrument of torture that stretches or disjoints or mutilates victims
a support for displaying various articles
examples: the newspapers were arranged on a rack

definitions.text: a form of torture in which pain is inflicted by stretching the body
a rapid gait of a horse in which each foot strikes the ground separately
put on a rack and pinion

examples: They extorted money from the executive by threatening to reveal his past to the company boss
They squeezed money from the owner of the business by threatening him

definitions.text: seize together, as of parallel ropes of a tackle in order to prevent running through the block
